alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 4:25AM CDT until May 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Crawford, Grant, Allamakee and Clayton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at McGregor. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, The Washington Street Bridge to Saint Feriole Island begins to flood and is closed. Pumping operations are underway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM CDT Saturday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
